content.description: The first few moves are the only challenge. This is a great beginner route.
content.protection: Top rope using long slings or static line from nested boulders at top

content.description: The arete on the southeast corner of the Thanks Obama Boulder. Climb up the Arete where it meets the ending of Thanks Obama Crack. The crux is getting off the ground and the first few tiny holds.
content.protection: Top Rope using long runners or static line from nested boulders or cams or hexs in the cracks at the top.

content.description: I like the first few moves off the deck and then is gets easy before you transfer to the upper section. A bit chossy transferring up so trusting the holds would be a challenge if you choose to boulder it to the top
content.protection: Access the top of the boulder from the west and use a couple of cams or nested boulders and some long webbing or a static cord to set up the top rope.
content.location: This climb is located on the northeast corner of the boulder just north of Trump's Wall.

content.description: Start on the west end and work your way across to the east and then up the arete on the southwest corner.
content.protection: Top rope long runners or lengths of static rope can be tied through the nested boulders on top. Hexs or large cams can be used in the cracks too
content.location: Head northeast from Chocolate Boulder. This is the largest boulder in the area.
